ground_truth: A barn is in the background as the sun rises. In the same position, John awakes. He and Rachel, who lie huddled in calm sleep, get up and start into the kitchen, watching a moment. They head for the stove where Rachel places her gun beside it, ready to hand, and picks up a coffee pot while John puts kindling in the stove. John looks at her for a moment. They look towards a sound as two troopers are shown, with sirens loud as they rapidly approach Rachel's house. Without her gun and holding John's hand, Rachel comes down to the fence. Meanwhile, the other children hurry out of the house behind them. The car brakes as the troopers, fanning wide, advance towards the barn. Rachel and the children are grouped a short distance behind as the barn door appears black. After a short pause, a preacher appears. The troopers close in on the preacher from before and behind, just as they did for Ben's arrest, with the same sickly look as at Ben's arrest. One trooper smacks the back of the preacher’s head with a pistol barrel, and the doll he is holding bursts open, spilling money over him. Two troopers gently lift John away, and Rachel lifts him in her arms and turns towards the house, carrying him as his head hangs back over her arm. Perhaps ten faces, most of them frenetic, watch. Our two loafers are having fun amid the general hubbub, which includes a gavel that stops the noise. John looks over his shoulder in the direction of the gavel, then at a finger. After a short pause, a lawyer’s hands gently help him from the chair and consigh him to Rachel. Above John’s head, Rachel mimics pantomime with a watch while everyone in a cafe stands. Rachel gathers her parcels as Icey rushes to the door, opens it, turns to the crowd, and shouts into the cafe, before turning to the street mob. Rachel hurries her children to the door, and Icey leaves the door to yell at the mob. As Rachel leaves the shot, the cashier shuts and locks the door. Mary and Clary come out first and start walking to the left while Rachel comes out and hurries off to the right, followed by John holding Pearl’s hand. The camera pans to Mary and Clary as they turn, and we pan with them as they hurry after Rachel, bringing Rachel into view as she charges away with her brood hustling to keep up. Icey carries a torch, flanked by rabid faces and smiling loafers, one with an axe. As she speaks, a man rushes to Walt with a rope. The camera pans to Rachel and the children past this street as they hurry towards Ruby, who stands alone in the background facing the jail, with Rachel and the children hurrying towards her in the background.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A shed is in the backdrop as the sun ascends. In the same location, John rouses. He and Rachel, who rest nestled in tranquil slumber, rise and proceed into the kitchenette, observing a moment. They move to the stove where Rachel situates her firearm beside it, ready to hand, and grasps a coffee pot while John places kindling in the stove. John gazes at her for a moment. They look towards a noise as two troopers are depicted, with sirens blaring as they swiftly approach Rachel's dwelling. Without her firearm and clutching John's hand, Rachel descends to the barrier. Meanwhile, the other youngsters scurry out of the dwelling behind them. The car halts as the troopers, spreading wide, move towards the shed. Rachel and the youngsters are grouped a short distance behind as the shed entry appears dark. After a brief pause, a minister emerges. The troopers enclose on the minister from before and behind, just as they did for Ben's capture, with the same pallid expression as at Ben's capture. One trooper strikes the rear of the minister’s head with a pistol barrel, and the figurine he is grasping bursts open, spilling currency over him. Two troopers gently lift John away, and Rachel lifts him in her arms and turns towards the dwelling, carrying him as his head droops back over her limb. Perhaps ten faces, most of them frantic, observe. Our two idlers are enjoying themselves amidst the general commotion, which includes a gavel that silences the clamor. John glances over his shoulder in the direction of the gavel, then at a digit. After a brief pause, an attorney’s hands softly help him from the seat and consign him to Rachel. Above John’s head, Rachel imitates mime with a watch while everyone in a cafe stands. Rachel collects her packages as Icey rushes to the entry, opens it, turns to the throng, and shouts into the cafe, before turning to the street crowd. Rachel urges her youngsters to the entry, and Icey vacates the entry to yell at the crowd. As Rachel departs the scene, the cashier closes and locks the entry. Mary and Clary emerge first and begin walking to the left while Rachel emerges and hastens off to the right, followed by John clasping Pearl’s hand. The camera pans to Mary and Clary as they turn, and we pan with them as they hasten after Rachel, bringing Rachel into sight as she speeds away with her brood hustling to keep up. Icey carries a torch, flanked by frenzied faces and grinning idlers, one with an axe. As she speaks, a man dashes to Walt with a cord. The camera pans to Rachel and the youngsters past this street as they hurry towards Ruby, who stands alone in the backdrop facing the jail, with Rachel and the youngsters hurrying towards her in the backdrop.

The camera pans to Rachel and the children past this street as Ruby is hurried towards by them, who stands alone in the background facing the jail, with Rachel and the children hurrying towards her in the background.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: As the sun rises behind a barn, John and Rachel awaken. They head to the kitchen, with Rachel placing her gun by the stove and making coffee while John adds kindling. Hearing loud sirens, they head to the fence. Troopers approach Rachel's house, and Rachel, without her gun, holds John's hand, leading the children outside. The troopers advance toward the barn where a preacher appears, and they surround him like during Ben's arrest. A trooper hits the preacher, causing money to spill from a broken doll. The troopers gently separate John from Rachel, who lifts him and returns toward the house as ten frantic faces watch. Amid the commotion, a gavel silences the noise, and a lawyer helps John to Rachel. She pantomimes with a watch as people in a café stand. Gathering parcels, Rachel hurries her children to the door, and Icey yells at a street mob. As Rachel exits, the cashier locks the door. Mary and Clary exit first, walking left, while Rachel and John, holding Pearl's hand, hurry right. The camera follows Mary and Clary, then pans to Rachel with her children rushing to catch up. Icey, with a torch, stands among a crowd as a man rushes Walt with a rope. Rachel and the children hurry past, approaching Ruby, who faces the jail.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A barn is in the background as the sun rises. John wakes up beside Rachel and they head to the kitchen. Rachel places her gun by the stove, picks up a coffee pot while John adds kindling. They hear sirens as two troopers rapidly approach. Rachel, without her gun, holds John's hand and approaches the fence as children hurry behind. The troopers advance towards the barn, and a preacher appears. A trooper hits the preacher’s head, spilling money from a doll. Troopers gently lift John, and Rachel carries him back. Faces watch, and amid chaos, a gavel stops noise. A lawyer helps John to Rachel. At a cafe, Rachel gathers her parcels, Icey opens the door, yells at the crowd, then closes it. Mary and Clary leave, followed by Rachel and John. The camera follows all as they hurry. Icey, with a torch, flanked by faces and loafers, shouts as a man rushes with a rope. The camera pans to Rachel and the children hurrying towards Ruby, who faces the jail.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As the first light of dawn gently casts its glow, a barn stands quietly in the background, partially silhouetted against the rising sun. At this tranquil moment, John awakens from his slumber. By his side lies Rachel, both nestled together in the peaceful warmth of sleep. Gradually, they rise from their repose and make their way toward the kitchen, pausing briefly to take in the serene surroundings. Their destination is the stove, where Rachel, with determined precision, places her gun beside it, ensuring it is within easy reach. She then reaches for a coffee pot, preparing to start the day. Meanwhile, John busies himself with arranging kindling in the stove. For a brief moment, John gazes at Rachel, a silent exchange passing between them. Suddenly, their attention is drawn toward a noise, and they turn to see two troopers rapidly approaching Rachel's house, sirens blaring loudly in the stillness of the morning.

Rachel, momentarily without her weapon, clasps John's hand securely as they descend towards the fence. Behind them, the other children emerge from the house with hurried steps. The troopers' car grinds to a halt as they fan out strategically, advancing towards the imposing barn. Rachel and the children maintain their position a short distance away, their eyes fixed on the hauntingly dark barn door. After a brief pause, a preacher appears, drawing the troopers' focus. They close in on him, mirroring their approach during Ben's arrest, their expressions the same as before, sickly and unsettling. Without warning, one trooper ruthlessly strikes the preacher’s head with the butt of his pistol, causing the doll he is holding to burst open, scattering money all around him.

Gently and carefully, two troopers lift John, guiding him away as Rachel tenderly gathers him into her arms. She turns back towards the house, cradling him with care as his head lolls back over her arm. Perhaps ten faces, most of them frantic and filled with anxiety, observe the scene unfold. Amid the general turmoil, our two loafers find amusement, reveling in the chaos just as the sound of a gavel abruptly quells the commotion. John glances back over his shoulder towards the source of the gavel's sound, then turns his attention to a pointing finger.

After a brief pause, a lawyer's hands gently assist him from the chair, relinquishing him back into Rachel’s care. Above John's head, Rachel playfully pantomimes with a watch, while everyone gathered in the café stands collectively, engrossed in the spectacle. As Rachel collects her parcels with urgency, Icey makes a swift move to the door, flinging it open, turning to shout at the crowd inside the café before addressing the street mob outside. Hastily, Rachel shepherds her children toward the exit, as Icey deserts her post to confront the mob vocally. As Rachel exits the frame, the cashier promptly closes and locks the door behind her, ensuring security.

Mary and Clary are the first to step out, heading toward the left while Rachel, full of determination, exits to the right, swiftly followed by John, whose small hand grips Pearl’s for support. The camera carefully pivots to follow Mary and Clary as they change direction, continuing to capture them as they rush to join Rachel, bringing her into the frame as she advances with her brood, who hustle to keep pace with her urgency. Meanwhile, Icey wields a torch, flanked by faces twisted in anger and rabid smiles, one of the loafers brandishing an axe menacingly. As Icey speaks, a man strides toward Walt, rope in hand. Once more, the camera pans, capturing Rachel and her children as they hurry past this street scene, their destination Ruby, who stands solitary in the background, facing the jail. All the while, Rachel and the children press onward, their figures small in the distance but their purpose unmistakably clear as they rush towards Ruby.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:

It is partially silhouetted against the backdrop of the rising sun. At this tranquil and serene moment, John awakens from his slumber, emerging carefully from the depths of his sleep. By his side lies Rachel, both nestled together in the cozy warmth that accompanies sleep. Gradually, they rise from their repose and make their way toward the kitchen, pausing for a brief moment to take in their serene surroundings. Without warning, one trooper ruthlessly strikes the preacher’s head with the butt of his pistol, causing the doll he is holding to burst open, scattering money all around him in a chaotic flurry.

Gently and carefully, two troopers lift John, guiding him away while Rachel tenderly gathers him into her caring arms. She turns back towards the house, cradling him with care as his head lolls back over her arm. Perhaps ten faces, most of them frantic and filled with anxiety, observe the scene as it unfolds before them. Amid the general turmoil, our two loafers find amusement, reveling in the chaos just as the authoritative sound of a gavel abruptly quells the commotion. John glances back over his shoulder toward the source of the gavel's sound, then turns his attention to a pointing finger.

After a brief pause, a lawyer's hands gently assist him from the chair, relinquishing him back into Rachel’s careful and protective arms. Above John's head, Rachel playfully pantomimes with a watch, while everyone gathered in the café stands as one, engrossed in the unfolding spectacle. As Rachel collects her parcels with urgency, Icey makes a swift move to the door, flinging it open, turning to shout at the crowd inside the café before addressing the gathered street mob outside. Hastily, Rachel shepherds her children toward the exit, as Icey abandons her post to confront the mob vocally. As Rachel exits the frame, the cashier promptly closes and locks the door behind her, ensuring security is maintained.

Mary and Clary are the first to step out, heading to the left while Rachel, full of determination, exits to the right, swiftly followed by John, whose small hand grips Pearl’s for support. The camera carefully pivots to follow Mary and Clary as they change direction, continuing to capture them as they rush to join Rachel, bringing her into the frame as she advances with her brood, who hustle to keep pace with her urgency. Meanwhile, Icey wields a torch, flanked by faces twisted in anger and rabid smiles, with one of the loafers menacingly brandishing an axe. As Icey speaks, a man strides with purpose toward Walt, rope in hand. Once more, the camera pans, capturing Rachel and her children as they hurry past this vivid and tense street scene, their destination Ruby, who stands solitary in the background, facing the jail. All the while, Rachel and the children press onward, their figures growing smaller in the distance, but their purpose unmistakably clear as they rush toward Ruby.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the sun begins to rise, casting a gentle light over everything, the silhouette of a barn becomes visible in the background, setting a peaceful scene. At the same time, John slowly awakens, stretching and adjusting to the new day. Lying beside him is Rachel, and together they rise from their calm slumber and head towards the kitchen, each step deliberate and quiet. Upon reaching the kitchen, Rachel gently places her gun beside the stove, ensuring it is within easy reach, and then carefully picks up a coffee pot, her movements precise and practiced. Meanwhile, John methodically gathers pieces of kindling and places them within the stove, preparing to start a fire. For a brief moment, John pauses his task to look at Rachel, sharing a quiet connection before their attention is pulled by a sudden sound. They glance towards the noise, their expressions shifting to concern as the sound reveals itself to be two troopers, their sirens blaring loudly as they quickly approach Rachel's house. Without pausing to retrieve her gun, Rachel holds John's hand firmly and leads the way down to the fence. As they move, the other children, alerted by the commotion, hurry out of the house to join them. The troopers' car screeches to a halt, and the officers fan out widely, advancing with purpose towards the ominous, shadowy barn. Rachel and the children stand grouped together a short distance away, watching intently as the barn door looms dark and foreboding. After a tense pause, a preacher emerges from the barn, drawing the troopers' attention. They close in on him from all directions, just as they had during Ben's arrest, their expressions mirroring the same sickly look of that past encounter. The tension reaches a peak as one trooper abruptly strikes the back of the preacher's head with the barrel of a pistol, causing a doll he is holding to burst open, scattering money onto the ground. In the ensuing chaos, two troopers gently but firmly lift John away, while Rachel swoops in, cradling him tenderly in her arms and turning back towards the house, his head lolling back over her arm. As the scene unfolds, about ten faces, animated and frenetic, watch the events unfold with growing intensity. Among the crowd, two loafers find amusement in the general chaos, their laughter adding to the noise that is suddenly halted by the sharp sound of a gavel. John, feeling the shift, glances over his shoulder towards the source of the sound, then turns his attention to a finger being pointed. A brief moment passes before a lawyer's hands gently guide John down from the chair, transferring him carefully to Rachel. Overhead, Rachel humorously mimics a pantomime with a watch while everyone in a nearby café stands in attention. As the situation slowly de-escalates, Rachel gathers her parcels with efficiency as Icey rushes to the door, swinging it open with urgency, turning to address the crowd within the café, then pivoting to confront the street mob outside. With determination, Rachel herds her children towards the door, an urgency in her step. Icey temporarily leaves her spot at the door to vocally confront the crowd, her voice cutting through the din. As Rachel and her family step out of view, the cashier quickly shuts and locks the door behind them. With quick steps, Mary and Clary emerge first, turning to the left and beginning their walk, while Rachel takes a swift right, leading her brood with John in tow, who is clutching Pearl’s hand tightly. The camera follows Mary and Clary as they turn, capturing their hurried pace as they rush after Rachel. This movement brings Rachel back into view, striding purposefully away with all her children hustling along to keep pace. Meanwhile, Icey brandishes a torch, flanked by the intense, rabid faces of the crowd and a group of loafers, one of whom casually carries an axe. As Icey delivers her fervent speech, a man, gripped by the moment, runs towards Walt with a rope in hand. The camera shifts focus, panning to capture Rachel and the children's movement past this tumultuous street scene as they make their way hurriedly towards Ruby, who stands alone as a solitary figure in the distance, her back turned to face the jail. Rachel and her children, moving with urgency, appear in the background, steadily approaching Ruby.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the sun rises behind a barn, John and Rachel awaken from their calm sleep and head to the kitchen. Rachel places her gun beside the stove while John starts the fire, and they share a moment before hearing sirens. Two troopers rapidly approach their house, prompting Rachel to leave her gun and hold John's hand as they move to the fence, followed by the children. The troopers advance towards the barn, where a preacher appears and is subdued, spilling money from a burst doll. Troopers gently remove John, and Rachel carries him towards the house, observed by a frenetic crowd. Amidst the hubbub, a lawyer helps John back to Rachel, who motions for time. In a café, Rachel gathers her parcels as Icey opens the door, addressing the crowd and street mob. As Rachel exits with her children, Icey locks the door. Mary and Clary head left while Rachel, with John and Pearl, moves right. The camera follows Mary and Clary as they catch up with Rachel and her brood, keeping pace with her hurried departure. Icey, carrying a torch and flanked by an animated crowd including a man with an axe, speaks to the mob. Nearby, Rachel and the children hurry past the street towards Ruby, who stands facing the jail.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A barn, reminiscent of those found in the rural landscapes of the American Midwest, is in the background as the sun rises over the horizon, casting a warm glow. In the same position, John awakes in the simple farmhouse. He and Rachel, who lie huddled in calm sleep, get up and start into the kitchen, watching the morning unfold through the window. They head for the cast-iron stove, a staple in many rustic homes, where Rachel places her revolver beside it, ready to hand, and picks up a coffee pot while John puts kindling in the stove to ignite a comforting fire. John looks at her for a moment, his gaze reflective of shared hardships. They look towards a sound as two state troopers, enforcers of law in these parts, are shown, with sirens loud as they rapidly approach Rachel's house, a scene reminiscent of past events. Without her gun and holding John's hand, Rachel comes down to the picket fence that lines their property. Meanwhile, the other children hurry out of the house behind them, their expressions a mix of curiosity and concern. The patrol car brakes as the troopers, fanning wide in a tactical maneuver, advance towards the old barn, an emblem of the property's history. Rachel and the children are grouped a short distance behind as the barn door appears black, hinting at untold stories within. After a short pause, a preacher, known to the community for his fiery sermons, appears. The troopers close in on the preacher from before and behind, just as they did for Ben's arrest, a local outlaw whose capture was a major event, with the same sickly look as at Ben's arrest. One trooper smacks the back of the preacher’s head with a pistol barrel, and the stuffed doll he is holding bursts open, spilling counterfeit money over him, a revelation of hidden crimes. Two troopers gently lift John away, and Rachel lifts him in her arms, displaying a mother's strength, and turns towards the house, carrying him as his head hangs back over her arm. Perhaps ten faces, most of them frenetic with curiosity and judgment, watch from the sidelines. Our two loafers, townsfolk with little to lose, are having fun amid the general hubbub, which includes a gavel that stops the noise, signaling a makeshift court in session. John looks over his shoulder in the direction of the gavel, then at a finger pointing accusingly. After a short pause, a lawyer’s hands gently help him from the chair and consign him to Rachel, offering a semblance of justice. Above John’s head, Rachel mimics pantomime with a watch while everyone in a bustling cafe stands in bewilderment. Rachel gathers her parcels as Icey, a familiar town gossip, rushes to the door, opens it, turns to the crowd, and shouts into the cafe, rallying the townsfolk, before turning to the street mob that has gathered outside. Rachel hurries her children to the door, and Icey leaves the door to yell at the mob, which is growing in aggression. As Rachel leaves the shot, the cashier shuts and locks the door, recognizing the brewing danger. Mary and Clary, the two eldest children, come out first and start walking to the left while Rachel comes out and hurries off to the right, a strategic separation for safety, followed by John holding Pearl’s hand protectively. The camera pans to Mary and Clary as they turn, and we pan with them as they hurry after Rachel, bringing Rachel into view as she charges away with her brood hustling to keep up, fleeing potential chaos. Icey carries a torch, a symbol of the town's heated emotions, flanked by rabid faces and smiling loafers, one with an axe, a threatening presence. As she speaks, a man rushes to Walt, a known troublemaker, with a rope, indicating the town's readiness for vigilante justice. The camera pans to Rachel and the children as they hurry past this tense street scene towards Ruby, a figure of hope, who stands alone in the background facing the jail, a reminder of the fate that awaits the preacher, with Rachel and the children hurrying towards her in the background, seeking solidarity in the face of uncertainty.

Rachel and the children are grouped a short distance behind as the barn door appears black. After a short pause a preacher appears. The troopers close in on the preacher from before and behind just as they did for Ben's arrest with the same sickly look as at Ben's arrest. One trooper smacks the back of the preacher’s head with a pistol barrel and the doll he is holding bursts open spilling money over him. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Two troopers gently lift John away and Rachel lifts him in her arms and turns towards the house carrying him as his head hangs back over her arm. Perhaps ten faces most of them frenetic watch. Our two loafers are having fun amid the general hubbub which includes a gavel that stops the noise. John looks over his shoulder in the direction of the gavel then at a finger. After a short pause a lawyer’s hands gently help him from the chair and consigh him to Rachel. Above John’s head. Rachel mimics pantomime with a watch while everyone in a cafe stands. Rachel gathers her parcels as Icey rushes to the door opens it turns to the crowd and shouts into the cafe before turning to the street mob. Rachel hurries her children to the door and Icey leaves the door to yell at the mob. As Rachel leaves the shot the cashier shuts and locks the door. Mary and Clary come out first and start walking to the left while Rachel comes out and hurries off to the right followed by John holding Pearl’s hand. The camera pans to Mary and Clary as they turn and we pan with them as they hurry after Rachel bringing Rachel into view as she charges away with her brood hustling to keep up. Icey carries a torch flanked by rabid faces and smiling loafers one with an axe. As she speaks a man rushes to Walt with a rope. The camera pans to Rachel and the children past this street as they hurry towards Ruby who stands alone in the background facing the jail with Rachel and the children hurrying towards her in the background.

Icey carries a torch flanked by rabid faces and smiling loafers one with an axe. As she speaks a man rushes to Walt with a rope. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A spaceship floats in the foreground as the moon sets. In the different spot, Bob dozes. He and Linda, who sit tangled in restless slumber, leap up and dash into the library, observing a scene. They head for the bookcase where Linda places her violin beside it, ready to strum, and grabs a lantern while Bob dumps confetti in the bookcase. Bob glances at her for a scene. They stare towards a whisper as two dragons are displayed, with trumpets quiet as they slowly drift towards Linda's castle. Without her violin and holding Bob's paw, Linda skates down to the river. Meanwhile, the other penguins dawdle out of the igloo behind them. The bike pedals as the dragons, marching narrow, retreat from the spaceship. Linda and the penguins are huddled a long distance ahead as the spaceship window appears purple. After a long pause, a mechanic appears. The dragons scatter from the mechanic from above and beside, just as they did for Jim’s departure, with the same cheerful appearance as at Jim’s departure. One dragon pats the top of the mechanic’s foot with a spoon handle, and the balloon he is clutching deflates, spilling candy under him. Two dragons softly drop Bob aside, and Linda tugs him in her fins and spins back towards the igloo, hoisting him as his toes droop forward above her fin. Perhaps five clouds, all of them tranquil, glance. Our two rabbits are jumping ropes amid the silent festival, which includes a bell that begins the melody. Bob turns over his elbow in the direction of the bell, then at a shoe. After a long pause, a baker’s elbows softly lift him from the couch and present him to Linda. Below Bob’s toes, Linda mimics charades with a balloon while nobody in a diner sits. Linda picks her sandwiches as Marco creeps to the gate, closes it, whispers to the band, and sings into the diner, before skipping to the lake crowd. Linda beckons her penguins to the gate, and Marco abandons the gate to shout at the crowd. As Linda enters the scene, the teller opens and unlocks the gate. Helen and Alex skip out first and stop dancing to the right while Linda skips out and strolls off to the left, followed by Bob clapping Jade’s fin. The camera zooms into Helen and Alex as they bend, and we zoom with them as they wander before Linda, taking Linda out of sight as she tiptoes away with her gang strolling to catch up. Marco waves a flag, flanked by sleepy clouds and cheering rabbits, one with a map. As he dances, a woman crawls to Tom with a kite. The camera zooms out from Linda and the penguins past this lake as they wander away from Emerald, who floats alone in the foreground waving at the forest, with Linda and the penguins wandering away from her in the foreground.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As the sun rises over a barn, John and Rachel awaken, head to the kitchen, where Rachel places her gun beside the stove while John starts the fire. Suddenly, two troopers with sirens approach, prompting Rachel, without her gun, and holding John's hand, to go to the fence as children follow. As troopers close in on a preacher, a fight ensues with money spilling from a doll. John is gently lifted away, embraced by Rachel. Amid the chaos, two loafers amuse themselves until a gavel quiets the noise. A lawyer helps John to Rachel, who mimics a watch while a cafe audience stands. As Rachel gathers her parcels, Icey opens the door and shouts at the crowd. Rachel hurries her children out, with Mary and Clary following. Icey, with a torch and crowd, includes a man with a rope. The camera pans to Rachel and children meeting Ruby, who stands facing the jail as they hurry towards her.
